title: Awkward line breaks in notification emails
content:
When viewed in the Outlook web app, notification emails based on some notification templates contain awkward line breaks.

Cause

Behind the scenes, Service Management uses standard HTML/CSS for the email body as defined in notification templates. The text with bad line breaks might not have proper CSS styles applied to handle text wrapping and line breaks.

Solution

You can solve the problem by updating the HTML code for the email body to add the required CSS code.

Perform the following steps to view and update the HTML code for the corresponding notification template:

  1. Go to Administration > Configuration > Studio.
  2. Select the record type for the notification template in the top left corner.
  3. Select the Notifications tab.
  4. In the left pane, select the notification template.
  5. In the template details pane, select the tab for the language with the line break problem.
  6. Click the Source ( ) button in the toolbar of the email body field. The system displays the HTML code for the email body.
  7. Update the HTML to add the required CSS code.
  8. Click Save.

The following provides an example for how to fix a specific problem.

In this example, a line break problem occurs on the first line of the email body, and the text is included in the span HTML element, as shown below.
